channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world

item.title: US, China to discuss export controls, officials say
item.description: U.S. Secretary of Commerce Gina Raimondo announced Monday that she and her Chinese counterpart agreed to discuss export controls in an ongoing effort to ease tensions between the two global economic powerhouses.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Fortinsky, The Hill

item.title: Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan plans to visit Russia to discuss collapsed Ukrainian grain deal
item.description: Tayyip Erdogan, the president of Turkey, plans to visit Russia to discuss a United Nations grain deal that collapsed. Russia quit the deal leading to its collapse.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan plans to visit Russia to discuss collapsed Ukrainian grain deal
item.description: Tayyip Erdogan, the president of Turkey, plans to visit Russia to discuss a United Nations grain deal that collapsed. Russia quit the deal leading to its collapse.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Libya’s foreign minister suspended after meeting with Israel’s chief diplomat
item.description: CAIRO (AP) — One of Libya’s rival prime ministers said Monday he has suspended his foreign minister a day after Israel revealed that its chief diplomat met with her last week — news that prompted scattered street protests in the chaos-stricken North African nation.
item.dc:creator: SAMY MAGDY, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: France's education minister bans long robes in classrooms worn mainly by Muslims
item.description: PARIS (AP) — France’s education minister announced Monday a ban on long robes in classrooms starting with the new school year, saying the garments worn mainly by Muslims are testing secularism in the nation’s schools.
item.dc:creator: ELAINE GANLEY, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Virginia man stolen from mom at birth travels the world to hug her for first time: ‘the oceans I’ve cried’
item.description: A mother whose son was taken from her at birth was reunited 42 years later when he flew over 5,000 miles to meet her and the rest of his biological family.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Virginia man stolen from mom at birth travels the world to hug her for first time: ‘the oceans I’ve cried’
item.description: A mother whose son was taken from her at birth was reunited 42 years later when he flew over 5,000 miles to meet her and the rest of his biological family.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Ukraine claims liberation of key southeastern town
item.description: Ukraine claimed Monday its forces had liberated Robotyne, a key town in the southeastern front that Kyiv has tried to fully seize for months.
item.dc:creator: Brad Dress, The Hill

item.title: Ramaswamy unveils foreign policy platform: 'We will be Uncle Sucker no more'
item.description: Republican presidential candidate Vivek Ramaswamy unveiled a foreign policy platform Monday that would significantly reduce the United States's international involvement, declaring, “We will be Uncle Sucker no more.” Ramaswamy said in a post in The American Conservative that the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Jared Gans, The Hill

item.title: Japan asks China to urge citizens to halt harassment after start of Fukushima wastewater release
item.description: TOKYO (AP) — Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida asked China on Monday to urge its citizens to halt acts of harassment, including crank calls and stone throwing at Japanese diplomatic facilities and schools, in response to Japan's release of treated radioactive wastewater from the damaged Fukushim
item.dc:creator: MARI YAMAGUCHI, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Pope Francis blasts 'backwardness' of conservatives in US Catholic church
item.description: United States conservatives have been accused of replacing faith with ideology by Pope Francis. The pope says a correct understanding of Catholic doctrine allows for change over time.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Russia's top security agency detains former consulate employee who is accused of collecting information for US
item.description: Russia's Federal Security Service has detained a former U.S. Consulate worker who is accused of collecting information about Russia's actions in Ukraine for U.S. Diplomats.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Poland, Baltic states will seal off Belarusian borders in event of any military incidents, migrant pushes
item.description: Poland, Estonia, Latvia, and Lithuania announced that they would seal their borders with Belarus in the event of any military incidents or massive migrant pushes.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: China drops COVID testing for international arrivals
item.description: China is dropping its requirement for a negative COVID-19 test result for international visitors beginning Wednesday in its latest step toward reopening the country. Foreign Ministry spokesperson Wang Wenbin announced the testing update at a Monday briefing in Beijing.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Sforza, The Hill

item.title: Moscow accuses Russian citizen of collecting information for US diplomats
item.description: Russia’s top domestic security agency is accusing a local employee of the U.S. consulate in Vladivostok of collecting information for American diplomats, according to The Associated Press.
item.dc:creator: Laura Kelly, The Hill

item.title: Iran summons Swiss diplomat over US seizure of Iranian crude oil that's now at port in Houston
item.description: TEHRAN, Iran (AP) — Iran has summoned a Swiss diplomat over the apparent U.S. seizure of Iranian crude oil from a ship that sat for months off Texas, an official said Monday, as the oil now appeared to be moored in Houston.
item.dc:creator: AMIR VAHDAT and JON GAMBRELL, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: China won't require COVID-19 tests for incoming travelers in a milestone in its reopening
item.description: TAIPEI, Taiwan (AP) — China will no longer require a negative COVID-19 test result for incoming travelers starting Wednesday, a milestone in its reopening to the rest of the world after a three-year isolation that began with the country’s borders closing in March 2020.
item.dc:creator: SIMINA MISTREANU, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Illegal logging thrives in Mexico City's forest-covered boroughs, as locals strive to plant trees
item.description: In the forest-covered mountains of Mexico City a brigade of farmers and forest rangers plant inches-high pine saplings in a recently cut stand of trees, even as the sound of chainsaws rings out nearby.
item.dc:creator: Maria Verza, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Some wildfire evacuations end in British Columbia, but fire threatens community farther north
item.description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia (AP) — The wildfire situation showed some improvement in British Columbia on Sunday, with more people being allowed to return home, but blazes continued to threaten communities farther north in Canada's Northwest Territories.
item.dc:creator: JIM MORRIS, Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: Russia says it confirmed Wagner leader Prigozhin died in a plane crash
item.description: MOSCOW (AP) — Russian authorities on Sunday confirmed the death of Wagner Group chief Yevgeny Prigozhin, putting to rest any doubts about whether the wily mercenary leader turned mutineer was on a plane that crashed Wednesday, killing everyone on board.
item.dc:creator: AP, NewsNation

item.title: Removing Fukushima's melted nuclear fuel will be harder than the release of plant's wastewater
item.description: The sound of treated radioactive water flowing to an underground pool could be heard as media toured Japan's Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant.
item.dc:creator: Mari Yamaguchi, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: With drones and webcams, volunteer hunters join new search for mythical Loch Ness Monster
item.description: Mystery hunters converged on a Scottish lake on Saturday to look for signs of the mythical Loch Ness Monster.
item.dc:creator: Jill Lawless, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Elite unit of Mexican cartel using drones to drop bombs: Report
item.description: The Jalisco New Generation cartel has created a specialized drone unit where members are trained to turn commercial drones into flying bombs.
item.dc:creator: Jorge Ventura, NewsNation

item.title: Mexico '99.9% certain' to elect first female president, expert says
item.description: Mexico in less than 10 months will elect a new president, and polls increasingly point to the new "strong man" being a woman.
item.dc:creator: Julian Resendiz, NewsNation

item.title: Reporter Evan Gershkovich appeals extension of detention in Russia
item.description: Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich has appealed a Moscow court’s decision to extend his pretrial detention in Russia until the end of November, according to documents on the court’s website.
item.dc:creator: AP, NewsNation

item.title: Reporter Evan Gershkovich appeals extension of detention in Russia
item.description: Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich has appealed a Moscow court’s decision to extend his pretrial detention in Russia until the end of November, according to documents on the court’s website.
item.dc:creator: AP, NewsNation

item.title: Crush of people at opening ceremony of the Indian Ocean Island Games in Madagascar kills at least 12
item.description: ANTANANARIVO, Madagascar (AP) — A crush of people at a stadium in Madagascar left at least 12 dead and 85 injured as sports fans attended the opening ceremony of the Indian Ocean Island Games, authorities said Saturday.
item.dc:creator: LAETITIA BEZAIN, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: India's lunar rover keeps walking on the moon, days after spacecraft's historic touchdown
item.description: NEW DELHI (AP) — India's lunar rover continued its walk on the moon Friday after the historic touch-down of India's spacecraft near the moon's south pole earlier this week, the country's space agency said.
item.dc:creator: ASHOK SHARMA, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: From tarantulas to tigers, zoo animals step onto scales for annual weigh-in
item.description: Staff at London Zoo got the measure of giant gorillas, plump penguins and skinny stick insects at the zoo’s annual animal weigh-in on Thursday.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Dutch brewer Heineken sells its Russian operations for 1 euro, taking a 300-million-euro hit
item.description: THE HAGUE, Netherlands (AP) — Dutch brewer Heineken has completed its withdrawal from Russia, 18 months after Moscow launched its full-scale invasion of Ukraine, selling its business in Russia for just 1 euro, the company announced Friday.
item.dc:creator: AP, WGN 9

item.title: FIFA opens case against Spanish soccer official who kissed player on lips at Women's World Cup
item.description: FIFA opened a disciplinary case Thursday against the Spanish soccer official who kissed a player on the lips while celebrating the team's victory in the Women’s World Cup final.
item.dc:creator: Graham Dunbar, WFLA, NBC

item.title: FIFA opens case against Spanish soccer official who kissed player on lips at Women's World Cup
item.description: FIFA opened a disciplinary case Thursday against the Spanish soccer official who kissed a player on the lips while celebrating the team's victory in the Women’s World Cup final.
item.dc:creator: Graham Dunbar, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Putin breaks silence on plane crash that presumably killed Wagner leaders
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has broken his silence on the plane crash that killed top leaders of the Wagner mercenary group.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Jet crash in Russia kills 10 and Wagner chief was on passenger list, officials say
item.description: A business jet en route from Moscow to St. Petersburg crashed Wednesday, killing all 10 people on board, Russian emergency officials said. Mercenary chief Yevgeny Prigozhin was on the passenger list, officials said, but it wasn't immediately clear if he was on board.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: India lands a spacecraft near the moon's south pole, a first for the world as it joins elite club
item.description: India became the first country to land a spacecraft near the moon’s south pole on Wednesday — a historic voyage to uncharted territory that scientists believe could hold vital reserves of frozen water, and a technological triumph for the world’s most populous nation.
item.dc:creator: ASHOK SHARMA, WFLA, NBC

item.title: India successfully lands its Chandrayaan-3 rover on the moon, near the south pole
item.description: NEW DELHI (AP) — India was counting down to landing a spacecraft near the moon’s south pole Wednesday — an unchartered territory that scientists believe could hold important reserves of frozen water and precious elements.
item.dc:creator: ASHOK SHARMA, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Search continues for Cuban coach who disappeared from Little League World Series
item.description: Investigators say the search continues for Cuba's Little League World Series coach Monday, despite reports that he's been found.
item.dc:creator: Vivian Muniz, WGN 9
